column4: hey, i get this error when i try to install ubuntu 7.10 64 on my desktop.... after it finishes installation: can't find os
i had it install over my previous windows install on one of the drives.
after i install ubuntu 7.10 on my desktop, i can't load it.  does it matter that i put it on a sata drive or anything like that?
anybody know why, after installing ubuntu 7.10 64 on my desktop, that it won't load after a restart?
i told it to do a install taking up an entire disk
Did you install GRUB or LILO?
grub
did it install perfectly, no problems?
yeah, it finished, then told me to restart, so i do
Do you get a warning stating "NO OPERATING SYSTEM" or something like that?
yeah, or like can't find OS
try an reinstall. Sounds like GRUB/LILO didn't install right.
did it 2x already
are you dual-booting?
no, i told it to overwrite the old windows partition
the error is: "error loading operating system"
Are you using the LiveCD or Alt Installer?
Live cd, 64bit 7.10
is there a way to make sure that the drive is formatted with the ubuntu livecd? i tried running the partion manager but it takes forever to load
Try using the Alt Installer, as it has more output.
The Alt Installer is the best, it's more verbose and works great, then the LiveCD atleast in my opinion.
does it matter that in the beginning it does give some error about /mnt/manager or something like that, saying that there is no disk space left, but then it just continues
Yes, that's bad. Again, the Alt Installer might work alot better.
